sub_topic: Determine the principal curvatures of a surface.
message_1: Suppose a given surface has a first principal curvature of 2 and a second principal curvature of 3 at a particular point. Determine the Gaussian curvature at that point.
message_2:
The Gaussian curvature (K) at a particular point on a surface is the product of the first principal curvature (k1) and the second principal curvature (k2) at that point. In this case, k1 = 2 and k2 = 3.

K = k1 * k2
K = 2 * 3
K = 6

The Gaussian curvature at that point is 6.
